Mapping the Data to a New Space
▪ A totally different view of the data can reveal important and 
interesting features
▪ Example
– The following points represented in the Euclidean space (x, y) are difficult 
for decision trees to classify
– However, if we represent the points in the polar coordinate system (r, θ), 
it is easy for decision trees to classify the points
